attributes.action: subsidise public transport where necessary to provide realist transport fares
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In Gateshead it costs more than £2 to travel on a bus. I conducted an informal survey in my area and all but 1 said they would GIVE UP there car if public transport was priced between 20 and 50 pence. The volume of people using such a service would mean it would probably break even or at least increase the till box recovery to a much higher extent. If profit was generated why not use it to built light rail systema? You cant tax people off the roads without providing a realistic alternative.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
